Flash Gordon.Action: Offers candy bar to Dale to calm her nervousness.
Rushes to take control of the damaged plane to help steer and land it despite lack of experience.
Encourages and instructs Dale to assist him with flying the plane.

Unsaps his belt, leaps up, races forward into the cockpit after the pilots vanish, scrambles into the pilot seat, takes control of the plane despite inexperience, fights controls to stabilize the dive.
Admits limited flying skills openly ('I've had a couple of lessons! -- just don't if I can land!') instead of pretending expertise.
Asks Dale to grab the other wheel and help pull the plane up, demonstrating teamwork and calm under pressure.
Aim the plane skillfully at the field despite surrounding hazards (red lightning bolts).
Whispers to Dale with calm advice to go with the flow and wait for a chance while in a dangerous situation.
Expresses bafflement but tries to cooperate and follow Zarkov despite confusion.
Calls Zarkov insane in a tense moment.
Recognizes the urgency of the situation and decides to follow Zarkov despite bafflement, showing adaptability.
Whispers to Dale to 'go with the flow' and wait for a chance while escaping gunfire, indicating tactical awareness and calm under pressure.
Breaks off his own sentence when interrupted, showing some hesitation or uncertainty in decision-making.
Calls Zarkov insane outright without further assessment in a crisis moment.
Leaps after Dale into the capsule to protect her despite danger.
Engages in physical fight with Zarkov to gain control of the capsule, risking harm to himself.
Finds Dale and folds his arms around her protectively during chaotic and dangerous situation.
Leaps after Dale into the capsule immediately, showing readiness and decisiveness.
Engages physically with Zarkov and fights him when Zarkov tries to control the situation via threat.
After the fight, staggers to his feet and immediately protects Dale from centrifugal force.
Does not assert control over the capsule or try to understand the controls after the struggle—he allows Zarkov to operate the capsule, being largely passive in technical matters.
Staggers to his feet and protects Dale under extreme centrifugal force and attack conditions.
Allows himself to be pressed against Dale by centrifugal force, showing physical resilience and protectiveness.
Flash's arms still holding Dale while semi-conscious, indicating protective and stable presence during crisis.
Capsule's sudden miraculous flight path change to avoid destruction, enabling survival.
No direct action to fix the capsule control panel despite danger; relies on the capsule's own course change.
Greets the alien leader warmly, offers friendship by extending his hand and smiling.
Does not react with hostility or anger after being shackled and thrown down; instead, makes a lighthearted comment to Zarkov.
Approaches the alien leader confidently and tries to communicate peacefully by introducing himself and offering a handshake, demonstrating confidence and social skill.
Fails to foresee the hostile response to the gesture of friendship and is quickly captured and manacled, indicating a lack of situational awareness or misjudgment.
Engages with Dale during the stressful march, responding to her with concern by asking what she is doing.
Engages with DALE when she suggests shutting eyes and dreaming, showing awareness and presence of mind despite dire circumstances.
No direct action demonstrating skill, intelligence, or confident behavior in this excerpt; mostly being marched as prisoner and observing surroundings.
Expresses urgency and concern about getting out of danger, confronts Zarkov with a threat to highlight the seriousness.
Questions Zarkov on how to get out, showing concern for their situation and readiness to take action.
Threatens Zarkov with a physical retaliation, showing confidence and assertiveness.
Appears uncertain or dependent on Zarkov's plan, not immediately proposing a clear alternative for escape.
Protects Dale by holding her as she shrinks back in horror.
Looks intently at Princess Aura despite the tense situation.
Introduces himself and his companions clearly and sincerely to Ming.
Introduces himself and his companions to Ming confidently and clearly, despite the intimidating and hostile environment.
Is visibly distracted and captivated by Princess Aura's appearance and behavior, showing vulnerability in focus.
Questions Ming about why Earth is being targeted, expressing concern and confusion.
Tense and ready to spring as Ming touches Dale Arden.
Attempts to stay together with Zarkov despite danger, showing loyalty and protective instincts.
Starts to defend Dale against the hooded guard, showing protectiveness and readiness to help.
Protects Dale by attacking hooded guards immediately.
Stands in front of Dale with raised mace, shielding her.
Shows hesitation to attack the Amazons because they are women.
Overcomes hesitation and fights the Amazons to protect Dale despite personal moral conflict.
Despite being overwhelmed and pinned down by numerous opponents, he summons a superhuman effort to free himself and pursue Dale.
Engages in a desperate chase up a dangerous staircase with unclear safety, resulting in him falling through a trap door alongside Aura.
Seizes Aura's ankle as directed, follows her lead to escape danger.
Stares at Aura after emerging from water, noticing her appearance.
Expresses gratitude by asking how to thank Aura for saving his life.
Seizes Aura's ankle as directed and follows her lead to escape danger underwater.
Initially shows hesitation or confusion when Aura instructs him to grab her ankle after hitting the water.
Collapses exhausted after emerging from the water, showing physical limits but also resilience.
Openly admits he is no good at lying when confronted by Aura.
Determines his mission to rescue Dale and Zarkov and save Earth, showing concern for others.
Observes the suffering of Lizardman slaves with apparent concern.
States clearly his priorities: finding Dale and Zarkov and saving Earth, showing focus and determination.
Admits he is no good at lying, displaying honesty but also a self-awareness of a social skill limitation.
Stops to observe the plasma cavern and its dangerous features, indicating attentiveness and situational awareness.
Stops Aura to ask about Dale, shows concern for her well-being.
Expresses doubt about trusting Aura but ultimately allows himself to be led by her.
Admits he cannot fly the rocket ship but is willing to learn from Aura.
Seizes Aura to stop her and asks pointed questions about Dale Arden, showing alertness and concern.
Expresses doubt about his ability to fly a rocket ship, openly admitting a lack of skill.
Listens to Aura's counsel to trust her and proceeds despite uncertainty.
Sits calmly in the cockpit and follows Aura's directions during complex spaceflight maneuvering, manipulating the glowing multi-colored panel with hand movements.
Does not respond to Dale's call immediately, resulting in her despair and impulsive drinking of unknown substance.
Expresses curiosity about the inhabitants of the moons and about forming teams to oppose Ming, showing concern for others' struggles.
Engages playfully with Aura by asking to learn Telekinetic Thought Transfer and pleading humorously, demonstrating friendly and sincere interaction.
Suddenly moves the craft sharply into a violent dive, risking danger to Aura, which suggests impulsiveness and possibly recklessness, detracting from warmth.
Moves his hands over the control panel to pull up and bank the craft to avoid danger.
Asks thoughtful questions about political alliances and his enemies, showing strategic thinking.
Suddenly moves hands sharply over the control panel causing the craft to dive violently.
Seizes Aura's wrists firmly to prevent her from interfering with his dangerous dive toward Ardentia to get her to put the gadget on his head.
Calls out to Dale Arden in a filtered voice, trying to reassure her presence and establish connection while she is captive and dazed.
Seizes Aura's wrists firmly to maintain control of the ship during a dangerous dive toward Ardentia despite her protests.
Confidently pilots the craft in a high-risk maneuver diving straight at the surface of Ardentia to achieve a specific goal.
Successfully establishes communication with Dale Arden despite challenging circumstances, demonstrating presence of mind and technical skill.
Reassures Dale through thought transference that he is with her and communicating, showing care and concern.
Openly shares information about his location and intentions with Dale, demonstrating sincerity and trustworthiness.
Dismisses Aura, Ming's daughter, as 'nothing to him' to reassure Dale.
Expresses deep concern and affection for Dale, promising to find and rescue her, encouraging her with supportive advice.
Uses sincere and caring language, calling Dale 'some girl' and expressing admiration and emotional connection.
Encourages Dale to use cunning and deceit (fake 'em out') to survive and accomplish multiple difficult tasks including freeing Dr. Zarkov and escaping, showing strategic thinking and confidence.
Despite dire circumstances, maintains composure and provides clear instructions and moral support, demonstrating leadership and capable communication.
Appears dazed and dreamy during a critical moment, needing to be slapped out of it, indicating distraction and lack of focus.
Apologizes for the rough landing with a lighthearted comment.
Offers a hand to Aura to help her out of the shuttle.
Recovers quickly after a rough landing that nearly throws him against his seatbelt.
Admits 'landings aren't my thing,' showing awareness of his own limitation without losing composure.
Struggles out of the craft and immediately offers a hand to Aura, showing readiness and leadership.
Asks 'Where's Robin Hood?' then quickly dismisses the question to focus on the immediate problem, showing adaptability and focus.
Pauses thoughtfully and questions whether Barin will help him, showing cautious consideration.
Gazes wistfully at the tree-house he dreamed of as a kid, showing momentary distraction but also a connection to his past.
Questions the loyalty and effectiveness of the allies presented to him.
Questions the ability of the allies with some skepticism but proceeds strategically with Aura and the Tree Men.
Expresses sympathy for TIGER MAN's struggle by relating it humorously to a past experience.
Hesitates when urged by Aura to intervene, showing restraint and trust in Aura's judgment.

Comments wittily about the situation ('I know just how he feels -- we played the Pittsburgh Steelers last year.'), displaying composure and presence of mind while watching a tense and dangerous fight.
Hesitates when Aura urges him to go inside and let her talk to Barin, showing some initial doubt or caution in a tense situation.
Steps out calmly to meet Barin, openly states his origins and mission, trying to build trust.
Expresses shock and hurt on realizing Aura's possible betrayal.
Steps out cautiously when called, identifies himself clearly and explains his situation to Prince Barin.
Shows surprise and distrust upon realizing Aura’s intentions to keep him hidden and possibly captive, suggesting a momentary lapse in judgment in trusting her.
Says 'I'm not your enemy, Prince Barin. we share a hatred of Ming.' showing an attempt to build trust and common ground.
Watches with horrified revulsion at the snake keeper's handling of the snake.
Attempts to reason with Prince Barin by appealing to their shared hatred of Ming, showing calmness and confidence in a hostile situation.
Stands passively and watches the snake demonstration with horror and revulsion, showing fear rather than taking action.
Asks Aura to deliver a message to Dale apologizing and expressing love, showing sincerity and concern for others.
Swallows nervously and hesitates before plunging his hand into a hole in the stump, showing vulnerability but no cruelty.
Refuses to send a message through Aura, showing distrust or sarcasm but no direct malice.
Refuses to blindly choose a hole after one man dies from the venom; hesitates and considers the danger carefully before acting.
Shows signs of emotional distraction and contemplates sending a message to Dale before proceeding, potentially indicating a momentary lapse in focus under pressure.
Finally acts with quick decisive motion to plunge his hand into one of the holes, demonstrating confidence and presence of mind in a life-threatening situation.
Encourages Barin to take his turn, despite the danger.
Jests towards Barin with a friendly insult, 'Boy. You oughta be handled with a forked stick yourself.'
Uses lighthearted teasing during a tense moment, showing camaraderie rather than hostility.
Plunges his hand into multiple holes with a lurking danger, showing calmness and confidence.
Uses a silent mnemonic (eeny-meeny-miney-mo) to decide between two remaining options, demonstrating quick thinking under pressure.
Manages to grasp the serpent quickly despite its fast movement, showing skill and ability.
Engages in some sarcastic banter ("Boy. You oughta be handled with a forked stick yourself."), which may suggest confidence but also slight recklessness.
Pauses to slash the cords freeing the Tiger Man from the net despite being chased and in danger.
Leaps into action fighting the serpent to protect others.
Trips over a vine while running but Tiger Man helps him up, no indication Flash resents or reacts negatively.
Immediately grabs a weapon and acts to neutralize a threat to himself and Tiger Man during the escape.
Quickly understands the situation and takes immediate action by snatching and readying a crossbow to defend himself and Tiger Man.
Keeps calm under pressure while climbing and facing pursuit, showing awareness of their environment and potential escape routes.
Protects himself and Tiger Man by cleverly faking surrender and firing at enemies.
Jumps into the passing basket spontaneously with Tiger Man, demonstrating quick reflexes and agility.
Identifies the color change in the canopy as blue, showing awareness and observational skills.
Feigns surrender by making a motion to throw down his weapon, then surprises the enemy by firing his crossbow at the last instant, demonstrating tactical cunning and presence of mind.
Laughs aloud and enjoys bouncing on leaves with Tiger Man, showing good-natured enjoyment.
Struggles vainly against the flower's tendril while Tiger Man tries to rescue him.
Quickly checks his wristwatch and uses the angle of shadows to estimate and choose the correct direction to the west.
Jumps and runs skillfully over the large bouncy leaves of the treetops, showing physical agility and quick adaptation to the environment.
Struggles vainly against the enormous flower's tendril that seizes him and is lifted up helplessly into the flower's maw.
Proposes to Barin that they team up to overthrow Ming instead of continuing to kill each other.
Is the captive in need of rescue, indirectly indicating reliance on others for help in a crisis.
Is carried aloft by Hawkmen to safety, similar to others in peril.
Referenced dismissively by Ming as 'nobody', implying others perceive him as incompetent or insignificant.
Reacts groggily but raises his head in response, showing alertness despite being stunned.
Immediately reacts to Dale's scream and quickly saves her from falling off the terrace, showing concern and quick decisive action to protect her.
Shares an intimate and affectionate embrace and kiss with Dale, openly expressing love and sincerity.
Proposes to unite with others to fight a common oppressor, showing inclusiveness and cooperative spirit.
Bounds to his feet and dives to catch Dale as she falls past the terrace edge, saving her from a deadly fall.
Proposes to team up with Vultan to defeat Ming, demonstrating strategic thinking and leadership.
Admits his past leadership without arrogance, speaks plainly about his experience.
Acknowledges the danger he faced with Barin, indicating honesty about threats.
Responds bitterly but accepts the situation he is forced into, showing reluctant acceptance rather than defiance.
Confidently accepts the challenge and the leadership role despite language barriers and hostile environment.
Jokes about past sports success to assert leadership, showing confidence but possibly underestimating the seriousness of the situation.
Demonstrates situational awareness and a readiness to face danger in the joust.
Expresses frustration verbally but continues forward resolutely.
Squeezes Dale's hand to offer comfort and support, showing calmness and reassurance.
Stops short and eyes pop upon seeing danger ahead, showing alertness and situational awareness.
Asks Barin to swear allegiance to their cause against Ming, showing concern for Aura and the greater good.
Fights Barin fiercely and risks himself on a deadly, knife-covered platform to win, showing bravery but primarily self-preservation and combativeness.
Responds to Dale’s encouragement and love with adrenaline and determination, showing loyalty and emotional connection.
Regains balance quickly after almost slipping and falling on a dangerous knife-studded surface.
Engages Barin in a dangerous whip fight on a swaying, tilting platform, using both whip skills and hand-to-hand combat effectively.
Shows strategic confidence by making Barin swear to join Vultan and oppose Ming if Barin defeats him.
Overcomes being driven back by Barin’s initial edge and uses a superhuman effort to flip Barin over the edge.
Dives onto the side amidst deadly knives to grab Barin’s wrist, demonstrating physical daring and quick reflexes.
Almost slips and falls immediately upon stepping on the disc, indicating a lack of initial footing or hesitation.
Grasps Barin's wrist to save him from falling into the abyss.
Encourages Barin to swing his body to gain leverage for escape.
Endures danger alongside Barin without abandoning him.
Flips Barin over his back and catches him by his wrist mid-air, preventing his fall into the abyss.
Instructs Barin to try to catch his other wrist and to swing his body to gain leverage and get a leg up.
Helps pull Barin to safety with Tiger Man.
Pulled up to safety from danger by Tiger Man, indicating reliance on team assistance rather than solo action.
Gazes at Dale lovingly, voices intention to be affectionate as soon as they land.
Immediately responds to Dale's distress call and orders his Hawkmen to follow and rescue her.
Quickly reacts to Dale being sucked upwards by commanding his Hawkmen to follow and climb after her.
Focuses momentarily on light romantic banter with Dale while in a highly dangerous situation.
Lets Vultan go despite the risky plan, showing understanding and tolerance.
Allows Barin to go free, indicating understanding.
Follows instructions in the test calmly and cooperatively.
Gives voice commands through the helmet to help Zarkov.
Quickly moves to the capsule and enters to presumably undertake a mission or action despite danger.
Moves quickly and silently to enter the capsule alone and initiates takeoff procedure, showing decisiveness and technical skill.
Communicates strategically using radio to contact allies on Hawkman frequency despite no initial response.
Demonstrates awareness by noting navigation numbers and maneuvering capsule toward Ming's city.
Encourages Vultan with a friendly, informal tone calling him 'you crazy ole bird', leaving the decision up to him.
Stops in dismay when a ray gun destroys Zarkov's capsule, lets out a bitter sigh but takes no immediate reactive action.
Uses invisibility and surprise to take down soldiers guarding prisoners without unnecessary harm.
Mocks soldiers as the 'ghost of all good men murdered by Ming' to frighten them into fainting.
Freely uses physical violence (punches, uppercuts, knocking guards out) against enemy soldiers.
Uses invisibility and stealth to approach and incapacitate soldiers effectively.
Creates a terrifying shadow to intimidate enemy soldiers, causing them to faint.
Attacks multiple enemies with skill and surprise, knocking them out efficiently.
Successfully escapes prison and guides companions to climb a difficult, narrow vertical shaft like mountain climbers, including using invisibility strategically.
Remains confident about a dangerous escape plan in a hostile environment, showing leadership and knowledge (knowing about the anti-gravity shaft and getting a guard to show him).
Enters invisibly to spy and report on a sealed cavern, providing critical information to allies.
Remains unseen and delivers information calmly despite the dire situation.
Intervenes to save Vultan by clasping his hand invisibly, disrupting enemy attack.
Urgently calls to get Zarkov involved to stop the wedding and take action against Ming.
Orders to go to the cavern first, attempting to get Zarkov involved in a crucial part of the mission.
Expresses alarm and urgency upon hearing wedding music, indicating awareness of enemy plans.
Interrupts Ming's forced wedding ceremony by seizing the ring and placing it on Dale's finger, demonstrating quick reaction and assertiveness.
Commands Dale to run to safety despite danger to himself.
Engages in a sword duel with Ming, distracting him and aiding his allies.
Pauses to look at himself when invisibility flickers, almost gets beheaded but quickly recovers and bounds up higher on the throne statue to continue fighting.
Seizes the instant to thrust his sword at Ming, taking decisive action against a great threat.
Stands proudly atop the statue, inspiring cheers and loyalty from others.
Places arm around Dale's shoulder tenderly, speaks with concern about her feelings.
Kisses Dale as they share a moment of closeness and affection.
Stands confidently atop the statue, receiving acclaim from the Mongons and Amazons, symbolizing leadership and victorious capability.
Comforts Dale tenderly after the battle, showing emotional intelligence and steadiness in a moment of loss.
Accepts the reality of losing the capsule and not being able to get home again with calm reassurance, showing pragmatic acceptance and focus.
